column4: I am looking for linux software similar to logmein, that will maintain a persistant outbound connection from our offices to our webservers.  once logging in, commands can be sent to the linux box at the office requesting a connection.  Similar to a hacker's reverse bind connect.  But I need a secure way to do this, as logmein does not support linux, and we are unable to port-forward at our offices.  Using ubuntu helena
vnc over reverse ssh tunnel
you can, just use an unused port
i've heard some good things about TeamViewer
ahhh, he won't allow it; doesn't mean you can't do it
thats the point of the tunnel, it IS requested
BedMan: How would I tell the server (behind the firewall) where to initiate the connection to?
you'd need a box you could ssh to directly; indeed thats all logmein and teamviewer provide, that middle box on the internet, not behind a firewall
your IP changed every minute or something?
no.  it never changes at the office.
why would you need cron to check a webserver for the ip?
the servers at the office accept no incoming connections, but the outside IP is static
can you ssh to any computer that is accessable on the internet?
yes.  our production web server has ssh via public key on different port
so ssh there, and use the -L or -R options to forward ports
you'd ssh to the port you're forwarding
do you konw of a good guide or a good term to google for?
google for vnc over ssh
thanks
thanks for your time too
if you want cli access, install screen abd use on the server you want to access
